data.text: @Tragik187 @Jonidot1 @lapublichealth Hey that's neat.  (By the by, heads up-- someone's spreading a mean rumor about you on the Internet that you send emojis to people to describe constipation.)  😬
@Tragik187 @Jonidot1 @lapublichealth Keep doubling down tho.  This is fun. https://t.co/H7UqEglEcN

@Tragik187 @Jonidot1 @lapublichealth Your stats were way wrong. I gave the *actual* TX H&HS citation, y'know, since you're so CLEARLY a stickler for data. 🤣 "Restrictive mandates" is obv a trash characterization-  but what should I expect from a dude w his cheeseball Hinge #iamverybadass profile pic set as avatar?

@fat__tire @Jonidot1 @lapublichealth My bad, you’re right. LA never had the worst case rights and the most restrictive mandates in the country at the same for several months in a row. And my stats came from Tx and CA public health. And you look like the emoji that people send each other to describe constipation.

@Tragik187 @Jonidot1 @lapublichealth Except your, uh, *smug* "there's a reason they don't give absolute #s and focus on disruptions" is #confidentlyincorrect + your stats are WAY wrong + your smug "all the data backs it up" that started this also is wrong. But aside from that, 💯, you rock! https://t.co/SBHfBWlDB8
@fat__tire @Jonidot1 @lapublichealth Doesn’t this look like… every other Covid graph curve everywhere? Pretty smug for a guy who has proved nothing.

@Tragik187 @Jonidot1 @lapublichealth Actual total cases reported for TX students: ~697K. You accidentally dropped ~50K for 2021 as well as everything before the count "reset" in Aug 2021. Then there's the 210,524 staff cases you also forgot. They too may have had SOMETHING to do with learning disruptions. 🤔
@Tragik187 @Jonidot1 @lapublichealth Your tweet has zero usable data on it. https://t.co/eteBFR7GGH
